column4: ok no difference with the sound but the startup sound only played twice.... dunno what its suppoed to do
hello, what do you get from 'uname -a'?
it's not enough to make a change to a file in an editor. You have to also save it before it can take effect.
'sudo update-grub' -- did this return any messages?
how many lines of output from 'grep pci=noacpi /boot/grub/menu.lst'?
this is the one where you were supposed to put it. But the update hasn't worked. Let's do it another way:
how many lines of output from 'grep pci=noacpi /boot/grub/menu.lst'? No paste please.
excellent. If it doesn't work after a reboot now, I'm gonna have to give up.
well, the change has gone through this time, but it obviously doesn't make a difference. Did you try the sound after booting from the desktop CD?
I'm just looking at bug reports on launchpad. There seems to be one similar
there are a few guys here who are better than I with sound. Try asking again in the evening (GMT).
